trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Cisco Webex | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Cisco Webex | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Cisco Webex with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Cisco Webex with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Cisco Webex
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Cisco Webex

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=524907).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=524907).

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Cisco Webex.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Cisco Webex.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Cisco Webex tenant
trans-unit.target: A Cisco Webex tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Cisco Webex will be able to single sign into the application at your Cisco Webex company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Cisco Webex will be able to single sign into the application at your Cisco Webex company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Cisco Webex
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Cisco Webex

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Cisco Webex
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Cisco Webex

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Cisco Webex.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Cisco Webex.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Cisco Webex, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Cisco Webex, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Active Directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Applications
trans-unit.target: Applications

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Add application
trans-unit.target: Add application

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Add an application from gallerry
trans-unit.target: Add an application from gallerry

trans-unit.source: In the **search box**, type **Cisco Webex**.
trans-unit.target: In the **search box**, type **Cisco Webex**.

trans-unit.source: Application Gallery
trans-unit.target: Application Gallery

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **Cisco Webex**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **Cisco Webex**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: Cisco Webex
trans-unit.target: Cisco Webex

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Cisco Webex with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Cisco Webex with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o)
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o)

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Cisco Webex** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Cisco Webex** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configure single sign-on

trans-unit.source: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Cisco Webex** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Cisco Webex** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configure single sign-on

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App URL** page, perform the following steps, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App URL** page, perform the following steps, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure app URL
trans-unit.target: Configure app URL

trans-unit.source: In the **Sing On URL** textbox, type your Cisco Webex tenant URL (e.g.: *http://contoso.webex.com*).
trans-unit.target: In the **Sing On URL** textbox, type your Cisco Webex tenant URL (e.g.: *http://contoso.webex.com*).

trans-unit.source: In the **Cisco Webex Reply URL** textbox, type your **Cisco Webex AssertionConsumerService URL** (e.g.: *https://company.webex.com/dispatcher/SAML2AuthService?siteurl=company*).
trans-unit.target: In the **Cisco Webex Reply URL** textbox, type your **Cisco Webex AssertionConsumerService URL** (e.g.: *https://company.webex.com/dispatcher/SAML2AuthService?siteurl=company*).

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Configure single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configure single sign-on

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Cisco Webex company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Cisco Webex company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click **Site Administration**.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click **Site Administration**.

trans-unit.source: Site Administration
trans-unit.target: Site Administration

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Site** section, click **SSO Configuration**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Site** section, click **SSO Configuration**.

trans-unit.source: SSO Configuration
trans-unit.target: SSO Configuration

trans-unit.source: In the Federated Web SSO Configuration section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Federated Web SSO Configuration section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Federated SSO Configuration
trans-unit.target: Federated SSO Configuration

trans-unit.source: From the **Federation Protocol** list, select **SAML 2.0**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Federation Protocol** list, select **SAML 2.0**.

trans-unit.source: Create a **Base-64 encoded** file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a **Base-64 encoded** file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] For more details, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o)
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] For more details, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o)

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, and then copy the content of it.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, and then copy the content of it.

trans-unit.source: Click **Import SAML Metadata**, and then paste your base-64 encoded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Click **Import SAML Metadata**, and then paste your base-64 encoded certificate.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** dialog page, copy the **Issuer URL** value, and then paste it into the **Issuer for SAML (IdP ID)** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** dialog page, copy the **Issuer URL** value, and then paste it into the **Issuer for SAML (IdP ID)** textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** dialog page, copy the **Remote Login URL** value, and then paste it into the **Customer SSO Service Login URL** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** dialog page, copy the **Remote Login URL** value, and then paste it into the **Customer SSO Service Login URL** textbox.

trans-unit.source: From the **NameID Format** list, select **Email address**.
trans-unit.target: From the **NameID Format** list, select **Email address**.

trans-unit.source: In the **AuthnContextClassRef** textbox, type **urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:ac:classes:Password**.
trans-unit.target: In the **AuthnContextClassRef** textbox, type **urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:ac:classes:Password**.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** dialog page, copy the **Remote Logout URL** value, and then paste it into the **Customer SSO Service Logout URL** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** dialog page, copy the **Remote Logout URL** value, and then paste it into the **Customer SSO Service Logout URL** textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click **Update**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Update**.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Cisco Webex** dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete**.

trans-unit.source: Configure single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configure single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Cisco Webex, they must be provisioned into Cisco Webex.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Cisco Webex, they must be provisioned into Cisco Webex.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Cisco Webex, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Cisco Webex, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To provision a user accounts, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To provision a user accounts, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your **Cisco Webex** tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your **Cisco Webex** tenant.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Manage Users \> Add User**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Manage Users \> Add User**.

trans-unit.source: Add users
trans-unit.target: Add users

trans-unit.source: On the Add User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Add User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Add user
trans-unit.target: Add user

trans-unit.source: As **Account Type**, select **Host**.
trans-unit.target: As **Account Type**, select **Host**.

trans-unit.source: Type the information of an existing Azure AD user into the following textboxes: **First name, Last name**, **User name**, **Email**, **Password**, **Confirm Password**.
trans-unit.target: Type the information of an existing Azure AD user into the following textboxes: **First name, Last name**, **User name**, **Email**, **Password**, **Confirm Password**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use any other Cisco Webex user account creation tools or APIs provided by Cisco Webex to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use any other Cisco Webex user account creation tools or APIs provided by Cisco Webex to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Cisco Webex, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Cisco Webex, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the **Cisco Webex **application integration page, click **Assign users**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Cisco Webex **application integration page, click **Assign users**.

trans-unit.source: Assign users
trans-unit.target: Assign users

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
